intro: Oreocharis wenshanensis, commonly known as the Wenshan oreocharis, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, showy flowers that typically feature a white or pale pink coloration. The plant grows in rocky or mountainous regions, often in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, delicate blooms during the spring season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
